intro: Catabrosella himalaica, commonly known as the Himalayan catabrosella, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
